Package jia

Class updateGoals

  • java.lang.Object
    • jason.asSemantics.DefaultInternalAction
      • jia.updateGoals
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jason.asSemantics.InternalAction, java.io.Serializable
    public class updateGoals
extends jason.asSemantics.DefaultInternalAction
    Internal action responsible to update (activate, inactivate, drop, create new...) goals each time it is called
    See Also:

      Prints a debug message if the debug mode is active
      private void select​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts, jason.asSemantics.Unifier un)
      All "gl::goalActivationRule" whose condition is satisfied are applied, i.e. the body of these rules are used to update the statuses of goals (setting statuses to "active", "inactive", or "dropped"), and having by definition the source equal to "self" since they are autonomously updated goals
      private java.util.ArrayList<jason.asSyntax.Term> sort​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts, jason.asSemantics.Unifier un)
      All goals statuses whose source is equal to "self" are filtered, based upon the "gl::goalImpact" rules that are active in the current context, and then the goals statuses that have at least one negative impact over an existing value are deleted the beliefs of the agent, anf finally as a last step all newly created or updated goal statuses are ordered accordingly to the order of importance of values, added to "orderedGoals" and returned by the function to be sent to the planning layer afterwards
      private void update​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts, jason.asSemantics.Unifier un, jason.asSyntax.Term givenGoal)
      All new given goals from whose source is equal to "user" by definition get the state "waiting" and are added to beliefs of the agent, and the information received by the planning and acting layers also update the status of goals with "success" or "fail"

      • update

        private void update​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts,
                    jason.asSemantics.Unifier un,
                    jason.asSyntax.Term givenGoal)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        All new given goals from whose source is equal to "user" by definition get the state "waiting" and are added to beliefs of the agent, and the information received by the planning and acting layers also update the status of goals with "success" or "fail"
        Parameters:
        ts - Transition System
        un - Unifier
        givenGoal - The goal given by the user to be achieved by the agent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • select

        private void select​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts,
                    jason.asSemantics.Unifier un)
        All "gl::goalActivationRule" whose condition is satisfied are applied, i.e. the body of these rules are used to update the statuses of goals (setting statuses to "active", "inactive", or "dropped"), and having by definition the source equal to "self" since they are autonomously updated goals
        Parameters:
        ts - Transition System
        un - Unifier

      • sort

        private java.util.ArrayList<jason.asSyntax.Term> sort​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts,
                                                      jason.asSemantics.Unifier un)
        All goals statuses whose source is equal to "self" are filtered, based upon the "gl::goalImpact" rules that are active in the current context, and then the goals statuses that have at least one negative impact over an existing value are deleted the beliefs of the agent, anf finally as a last step all newly created or updated goal statuses are ordered accordingly to the order of importance of values, added to "orderedGoals" and returned by the function to be sent to the planning layer afterwards
        Parameters:
        ts - Transition System
        un - Unifier
        Returns:
        The totally ordered st of goals to be sent to the planning layer

      • makeExpressionGround

        private java.lang.String makeExpressionGround​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts,
                                              jason.asSemantics.Unifier un,
                                              jason.asSyntax.Literal l,
                                              int index)
        Makes an expression ground by replacing variables with terms, e.g. "at(tv, Room)" can be grounded to "at(tv, bedroom)" or "at(tv, livingroom)"
        Parameters:
        ts - Transition System
        un - Unifier
        l - Literal to be grounded (make variables become terms)
        index - The index of the literal we want to ground, e.g. index = 2 means we ground the variable "Room" in "at(tv, Room)"
        Returns:
        Returns the literal grounded, e.g. if Room in "at(tv, Room)" is solved to "bedroom", then it returns "at(tv, bedroom)"

      • printDebug

        private void printDebug​(jason.asSemantics.TransitionSystem ts,
